result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua D Schultz

records.addlTxt: Sent to Defendant and DOC.
Sent to Defendant and DOC.

Defendant Joshua D Schultz in court.  Attorney Danuta Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christine Bruen in court for Joshua D Schultz. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters N/C plea to Ct. 2 in 22CM35.
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty re: Ct. 2 in 22CM35 with Ct. 1 dismissed & read-in.
Statements by ADA Kurczewski and Atty. Bruen - jt. recommendation.
Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation re: Ct. 2 in 22CM35 concurrent w/22CM93; Ct. 1 dismissed & read-in  Conditions of probation are as follows:
-defendant to pay costs/supervision fees
-Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant provided w/Notice of Appeal Rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
